description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study - orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical/ each session contained one trial

baseline = participants only acquire the nut-cracking behavior individually/ anvil_locked = participants were encouraged to explore options other than using the anvil as hammer to crack open the nuts / social = participants could potentially learn the nut-cracking behavior through social learning after observing a conspecific model
type of nut used in the experiment
time when the participant session starts in the video tape
whether the participant took one nut - y =yes/ n = no
whether the participant hammered on the nut - y = yes/n = no
whether the nut got cracked by hammering - y = yes/n = no
number of nuts cracked by hammering. Note: entry of n for dokana is unknown
whether the participant cracked the nut with their mouth - y = yes/n = no
number of nuts cracked with mouth
whether the participant placed the nut on anvil
whether the participant placed the nut in the hole on anvil - y = yes / n = no
whether an anvil was involved in cracking
whether the participant used another behavior for cracking
author provided notes - order of participant behavior for nut cracking
